bfgs_test.cpp

Minimizes function "func" by using the Broyden-Fletcher-Goldfarb-Shanno-algorithm. Given a function func of N variables, from which the gradient or first partial derivatives at arbitrary points can be computed and which can be locally approximated by the quadratic form of equation

then the number of unknown parameters in is equal to the number of free parameters in and , which is . To gather information about these parameters, function evaluations and line minimizations are used. BFGS as a variable metric method builds up, iteratively, a good approximation to the inverse Hessian matrix , that is, to construct a sequence of matrices with the property,

The number of iterations can be restricted.

Parameters:
p N-dimensional initial starting point.
gtol Convergence requirement on zeoring the gradient.
iter Number of iterations that were performed by the function.
fret Minimum value of the function.
func The function that will be minimized.
dfunc The derivation of func.
iterMax Max. number of allowed iterations.
linmintype Type of algorithm used for line minimization, possible values are LNSRCH for lnsrch, CBLNSRCH for cblnsrch, LINMIN for linmin and DERIVLINMIN for dlinmin .
Returns:
none.
Exceptions:
check_exception the type of the exception will be "size mismatch" and indicates that p is not one-dimensional
Please follow the link to view the source code of the example. The example can be executed in the example directory of package LinAlg.

Author:
M. Kreutz
Date:
1995
Changes
none
Status
stable
See also:
lnsrch.cpp, cblnsrch.cpp, linmin.cpp, dlinmin.cpp, bfgs2.cpp

00055 #include <iostream>
00056 #include "Array/ArrayIo.h"
00057 #include "LinAlg/arrayoptimize.h"
00058 
00059 using namespace std;
00060 
00061 
00062 // The testfunction: 
00063 double testfunc(const Array< double >& x)
00064 {
00065     return x(0) * x(0) + 2;
00066 }
00067 
00068 
00069 // The derivation of the testfunction: 
00070 void dtestfunc(const Array< double >& x, Array< double >& y)
00071 {
00072     y = 2*x(0);
00073     return;
00074 }
00075 
00076 
00077 int main()
00078 {
00079     double          fret(0.),      // minimum of the function
00080                     gtol(0.);      // convergence requirement
00081     unsigned        iter(0),       // no. of iterations performed
00082                                    // by the bfgs-function
00083                     iterMax(200),  // max. number of allowed iterations
00084                     i;             // counter value
00085     Array< double > p(1),          // initial starting point
00086                     xi(1);         // search direction
00087 
00088 
00089     cout << "Performing minimization for function f(x) = x*x + 2 "
00090          << "with starting point (-3,11) and direction (3,11):" << endl 
00091          << endl;
00092  
00093     // Perform minimization with all four line minimization
00094     // algorithms as subroutines:
00095     for (i = 0; i < 4; i++)
00096     {
00097         // Initialize starting point and search direction:
00098         p(0) = -3.;
00099         xi(0) = 3.;
00100 
00101         // Output of subroutine types:
00102         switch( i ) {
00103             case 0 : cout << "Using linesearch as subroutine:" << endl;
00104                      break;
00105             case 1 : cout << "Using cubelinesearch as subroutine:" << endl;
00106                      break;
00107             case 2 : cout << "Using linear minimization as subroutine:" 
00108                           << endl;
00109                      break;
00110             case 3 : cout << "Using derived linear minimization as "
00111                           << "subroutine:" << endl;
00112                      break;
00113         }
00114       
00115         // Minimization of test function:
00116         bfgs(p, gtol, iter, fret, testfunc, dtestfunc, iterMax, 
00117              (LinMinTypes) i);
00118 
00119         // Output of results:
00120         cout << "current starting point = point where function " 
00121              << "takes it minimum value:" << endl;
00122         writeArray(p, cout);
00123         cout << "minimum of function:" << endl;
00124         cout << fret << endl;   
00125         cout << "number of iterations performed:" << endl;
00126         cout << iter << endl;
00127         cout << endl << endl;
00128     }
00129 
00130     return 0;
00131 }
